043/** This class is for the ADIS16470 IMU that connects to the RoboRIO SPI port. */
044@SuppressWarnings({
045  "unused",
046  "PMD.RedundantFieldInitializer",
047  "PMD.ImmutableField",
048  "PMD.SingularField",
049  "PMD.CollapsibleIfStatements",
050  "PMD.MissingOverride",
051  "PMD.EmptyIfStmt",
052  "PMD.EmptyStatementNotInLoop"
053})
054public class ADIS16470_IMU implements Gyro, NTSendable {
055  /* ADIS16470 Register Map Declaration */
056  private static final int FLASH_CNT = 0x00; // Flash memory write count
057  private static final int DIAG_STAT = 0x02; // Diagnostic and operational status
058  private static final int X_GYRO_LOW = 0x04; // X-axis gyroscope output, lower word
059  private static final int X_GYRO_OUT = 0x06; // X-axis gyroscope output, upper word
060  private static final int Y_GYRO_LOW = 0x08; // Y-axis gyroscope output, lower word
061  private static final int Y_GYRO_OUT = 0x0A; // Y-axis gyroscope output, upper word
062  private static final int Z_GYRO_LOW = 0x0C; // Z-axis gyroscope output, lower word
063  private static final int Z_GYRO_OUT = 0x0E; // Z-axis gyroscope output, upper word
064  private static final int X_ACCL_LOW = 0x10; // X-axis accelerometer output, lower word
065  private static final int X_ACCL_OUT = 0x12; // X-axis accelerometer output, upper word
066  private static final int Y_ACCL_LOW = 0x14; // Y-axis accelerometer output, lower word
067  private static final int Y_ACCL_OUT = 0x16; // Y-axis accelerometer output, upper word
068  private static final int Z_ACCL_LOW = 0x18; // Z-axis accelerometer output, lower word
069  private static final int Z_ACCL_OUT = 0x1A; // Z-axis accelerometer output, upper word
070  private static final int TEMP_OUT = 0x1C; // Temperature output (internal, not calibrated)
071  private static final int TIME_STAMP = 0x1E; // PPS mode time stamp
072  private static final int X_DELTANG_LOW = 0x24; // X-axis delta angle output, lower word
073  private static final int X_DELTANG_OUT = 0x26; // X-axis delta angle output, upper word
074  private static final int Y_DELTANG_LOW = 0x28; // Y-axis delta angle output, lower word
075  private static final int Y_DELTANG_OUT = 0x2A; // Y-axis delta angle output, upper word
076  private static final int Z_DELTANG_LOW = 0x2C; // Z-axis delta angle output, lower word
077  private static final int Z_DELTANG_OUT = 0x2E; // Z-axis delta angle output, upper word
078  private static final int X_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x30; // X-axis delta velocity output, lower word
079  private static final int X_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x32; // X-axis delta velocity output, upper word
080  private static final int Y_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x34; // Y-axis delta velocity output, lower word
081  private static final int Y_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x36; // Y-axis delta velocity output, upper word
082  private static final int Z_DELTVEL_LOW = 0x38; // Z-axis delta velocity output, lower word
083  private static final int Z_DELTVEL_OUT = 0x3A; // Z-axis delta velocity output, upper word
084  private static final int XG_BIAS_LOW =
085      0x40; // X-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
086  private static final int XG_BIAS_HIGH =
087      0x42; // X-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
088  private static final int YG_BIAS_LOW =
089      0x44; // Y-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
090  private static final int YG_BIAS_HIGH =
091      0x46; // Y-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
092  private static final int ZG_BIAS_LOW =
093      0x48; // Z-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, lower word
094  private static final int ZG_BIAS_HIGH =
095      0x4A; // Z-axis gyroscope bias offset correction, upper word
096  private static final int XA_BIAS_LOW =
097      0x4C; // X-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
098  private static final int XA_BIAS_HIGH =
099      0x4E; // X-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
100  private static final int YA_BIAS_LOW =
101      0x50; // Y-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
102  private static final int YA_BIAS_HIGH =
103      0x52; // Y-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
104  private static final int ZA_BIAS_LOW =
105      0x54; // Z-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, lower word
106  private static final int ZA_BIAS_HIGH =
107      0x56; // Z-axis accelerometer bias offset correction, upper word
108  private static final int FILT_CTRL = 0x5C; // Filter control
109  private static final int MSC_CTRL = 0x60; // Miscellaneous control
110  private static final int UP_SCALE = 0x62; // Clock scale factor, PPS mode
111  private static final int DEC_RATE = 0x64; // Decimation rate control (output data rate)
112  private static final int NULL_CNFG = 0x66; // Auto-null configuration control
113  private static final int GLOB_CMD = 0x68; // Global commands
114  private static final int FIRM_REV = 0x6C; // Firmware revision
115  private static final int FIRM_DM = 0x6E; // Firmware revision date, month and day
116  private static final int FIRM_Y = 0x70; // Firmware revision date, year
117  private static final int PROD_ID = 0x72; // Product identification
118  private static final int SERIAL_NUM = 0x74; // Serial number (relative to assembly lot)
119  private static final int USER_SCR1 = 0x76; // User scratch register 1
120  private static final int USER_SCR2 = 0x78; // User scratch register 2
121  private static final int USER_SCR3 = 0x7A; // User scratch register 3
122  private static final int FLSHCNT_LOW = 0x7C; // Flash update count, lower word
123  private static final int FLSHCNT_HIGH = 0x7E; // Flash update count, upper word
124
125  private static final byte[] m_autospi_x_packet = {
126    X_DELTANG_OUT,
127    FLASH_CNT,
128    X_DELTANG_LOW,
129    FLASH_CNT,
130    X_GYRO_OUT,
131    FLASH_CNT,
132    Y_GYRO_OUT,
133    FLASH_CNT,
134    Z_GYRO_OUT,
135    FLASH_CNT,
136    X_ACCL_OUT,
137    FLASH_CNT,
138    Y_ACCL_OUT,
139    FLASH_CNT,
140    Z_ACCL_OUT,
141    FLASH_CNT
142  };
143
144  private static final byte[] m_autospi_y_packet = {
145    Y_DELTANG_OUT,
146    FLASH_CNT,
147    Y_DELTANG_LOW,
148    FLASH_CNT,
149    X_GYRO_OUT,
150    FLASH_CNT,
151    Y_GYRO_OUT,
152    FLASH_CNT,
153    Z_GYRO_OUT,
154    FLASH_CNT,
155    X_ACCL_OUT,
156    FLASH_CNT,
157    Y_ACCL_OUT,
158    FLASH_CNT,
159    Z_ACCL_OUT,
160    FLASH_CNT
161  };
162
163  private static final byte[] m_autospi_z_packet = {
164    Z_DELTANG_OUT,
165    FLASH_CNT,
166    Z_DELTANG_LOW,
167    FLASH_CNT,
168    X_GYRO_OUT,
169    FLASH_CNT,
170    Y_GYRO_OUT,
171    FLASH_CNT,
172    Z_GYRO_OUT,
173    FLASH_CNT,
174    X_ACCL_OUT,
175    FLASH_CNT,
176    Y_ACCL_OUT,
177    FLASH_CNT,
178    Z_ACCL_OUT,
179    FLASH_CNT
180  };
181
182  public enum IMUAxis {
183    kX,
184    kY,
185    kZ
186  }
187
188  public enum ADIS16470CalibrationTime {
189    _32ms(0),
190    _64ms(1),
191    _128ms(2),
192    _256ms(3),
193    _512ms(4),
194    _1s(5),
195    _2s(6),
196    _4s(7),
197    _8s(8),
198    _16s(9),
199    _32s(10),
200    _64s(11);
201
202    private int value;
203
204    private ADIS16470CalibrationTime(int value) {
205      this.value = value;
206    }
207  }
208
209  // Static Constants
210  private static final double delta_angle_sf = 2160.0 / 2147483648.0; /* 2160 / (2^31) */
211  private static final double rad_to_deg = 57.2957795;
212  private static final double deg_to_rad = 0.0174532;
213  private static final double grav = 9.81;
214
215  // User-specified yaw axis
216  private IMUAxis m_yaw_axis;
217
218  // Instant raw outputs
219  private double m_gyro_x = 0.0;
220  private double m_gyro_y = 0.0;
221  private double m_gyro_z = 0.0;
222  private double m_accel_x = 0.0;
223  private double m_accel_y = 0.0;
224  private double m_accel_z = 0.0;
225
226  // Integrated gyro angle
227  private double m_integ_angle = 0.0;
228
229  // Complementary filter variables
230  private double m_dt = 0.0;
231  private double m_alpha = 0.0;
232  private double m_tau = 1.0;
233  private double m_compAngleX = 0.0;
234  private double m_compAngleY = 0.0;
235  private double m_accelAngleX = 0.0;
236  private double m_accelAngleY = 0.0;
237
238  // State variables
239  private volatile boolean m_thread_active = false;
240  private int m_calibration_time = 0;
241  private volatile boolean m_first_run = true;
242  private volatile boolean m_thread_idle = false;
243  private boolean m_auto_configured = false;
244  private double m_scaled_sample_rate = 2500.0;
245
246  // Resources
247  private SPI m_spi;
248  private SPI.Port m_spi_port;
249  private DigitalInput m_auto_interrupt;
250  private DigitalOutput m_reset_out;
251  private DigitalInput m_reset_in;
252  private DigitalOutput m_status_led;
253  private Thread m_acquire_task;
254
255  private SimDevice m_simDevice;
256  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleX;
257  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleY;
258  private SimDouble m_simGyroAngleZ;
259  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateX;
260  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateY;
261  private SimDouble m_simGyroRateZ;
262  private SimDouble m_simAccelX;
263  private SimDouble m_simAccelY;
264  private SimDouble m_simAccelZ;
265
266  private static class AcquireTask implements Runnable {
267    private ADIS16470_IMU imu;
268
269    public AcquireTask(ADIS16470_IMU imu) {
270      this.imu = imu;
271    }
272
273    @Override
274    public void run() {
275      imu.acquire();
276    }
277  }
278
279  public ADIS16470_IMU() {
280    this(IMUAxis.kZ, SPI.Port.kOnboardCS0, ADIS16470CalibrationTime._4s);
281  }
282
283  /**
284   * @param yaw_axis The axis that measures the yaw
285   * @param port The SPI Port the gyro is plugged into
286   * @param cal_time Calibration time
287   */
288  public ADIS16470_IMU(IMUAxis yaw_axis, SPI.Port port, ADIS16470CalibrationTime cal_time) {
289    m_yaw_axis = yaw_axis;
290    m_calibration_time = cal_time.value;
291    m_spi_port = port;
292
293    m_acquire_task = new Thread(new AcquireTask(this));
294
295    m_simDevice = SimDevice.create("Gyro:ADIS16470", port.value);
296    if (m_simDevice != null) {
297      m_simGyroAngleX = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
298      m_simGyroAngleY = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
299      m_simGyroAngleZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_angle_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
300      m_simGyroRateX = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
301      m_simGyroRateY = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
302      m_simGyroRateZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("gyro_rate_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
303      m_simAccelX = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_x", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
304      m_simAccelY = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_y", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
305      m_simAccelZ = m_simDevice.createDouble("accel_z", SimDevice.Direction.kInput, 0.0);
306    }
307
308    if (m_simDevice == null) {
309      // Force the IMU reset pin to toggle on startup (doesn't require DS enable)
310      // Relies on the RIO hardware by default configuring an output as low
311      // and configuring an input as high Z. The 10k pull-up resistor internal to the
312      // IMU then forces the reset line high for normal operation.
313      m_reset_out = new DigitalOutput(27); // Drive SPI CS2 (IMU RST) low
314      Timer.delay(0.01); // Wait 10ms
315      m_reset_out.close();
316      m_reset_in = new DigitalInput(27); // Set SPI CS2 (IMU RST) high
317      Timer.delay(0.25); // Wait 250ms for reset to complete
318
319      if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
320        return;
321      }
322
323      // Set IMU internal decimation to 4 (output data rate of 2000 SPS / (4 + 1) =
324      // 400Hz)
325      writeRegister(DEC_RATE, 4);
326
327      // Set data ready polarity (HIGH = Good Data), Disable gSense Compensation and
328      // PoP
329      writeRegister(MSC_CTRL, 1);
330
331      // Configure IMU internal Bartlett filter
332      writeRegister(FILT_CTRL, 0);
333
334      // Configure continuous bias calibration time based on user setting
335      writeRegister(NULL_CNFG, (m_calibration_time | 0x0700));
336
337      // Notify DS that IMU calibration delay is active
338      DriverStation.reportWarning(
339          "ADIS16470 IMU Detected. Starting initial calibration delay.", false);
340
341      // Wait for samples to accumulate internal to the IMU (110% of user-defined
342      // time)
343      try {
344        Thread.sleep((long) (Math.pow(2.0, m_calibration_time) / 2000 * 64 * 1.1 * 1000));
345      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
346      }
347
348      // Write offset calibration command to IMU
349      writeRegister(GLOB_CMD, 0x0001);
350
351      // Configure and enable auto SPI
352      if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
353        return;
354      }
355
356      // Let the user know the IMU was initiallized successfully
357      DriverStation.reportWarning("ADIS16470 IMU Successfully Initialized!", false);
358
359      // Drive "Ready" LED low
360      m_status_led = new DigitalOutput(28); // Set SPI CS3 (IMU Ready LED) low
361    }
362
363    // Report usage and post data to DS
364    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_ADIS16470, 0);
365  }
366
367  /**
368   * @param buf
369   * @return
370   */
371  private static int toUShort(ByteBuffer buf) {
372    return (buf.getShort(0)) & 0xFFFF;
373  }
374
375  /**
376   * @param sint
377   * @return
378   */
379  private static long toULong(int sint) {
380    return sint & 0x00000000FFFFFFFFL;
381  }
382
383  /**
384   * @param buf
385   * @return
386   */
387  private static int toShort(int... buf) {
388    return (short) (((buf[0] & 0xFF) << 8) + ((buf[1] & 0xFF) << 0));
389  }
390
391  /**
392   * @param buf
393   * @return
394   */
395  private static int toInt(int... buf) {
396    return (int)
397        ((buf[0] & 0xFF) << 24 | (buf[1] & 0xFF) << 16 | (buf[2] & 0xFF) << 8 | (buf[3] & 0xFF));
398  }
399
400  /**
401   * Switch to standard SPI mode.
402   *
403   * @return
404   */
405  private boolean switchToStandardSPI() {
406    // Check to see whether the acquire thread is active. If so, wait for it to stop
407    // producing data.
408    if (m_thread_active) {
409      m_thread_active = false;
410      while (!m_thread_idle) {
411        try {
412          Thread.sleep(10);
413        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
414        }
415      }
416      System.out.println("Paused the IMU processing thread successfully!");
417      // Maybe we're in auto SPI mode? If so, kill auto SPI, and then SPI.
418      if (m_spi != null && m_auto_configured) {
419        m_spi.stopAuto();
420        // We need to get rid of all the garbage left in the auto SPI buffer after
421        // stopping it.
422        // Sometimes data magically reappears, so we have to check the buffer size a
423        // couple of times
424        // to be sure we got it all. Yuck.
425        int[] trashBuffer = new int[200];
426        try {
427          Thread.sleep(100);
428        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
429        }
430        int data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, 0, 0);
431        while (data_count > 0) {
432          m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, Math.min(data_count, 200), 0);
433          data_count = m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(trashBuffer, 0, 0);
434        }
435        System.out.println("Paused auto SPI successfully.");
436      }
437    }
438    // There doesn't seem to be a SPI port active. Let's try to set one up
439    if (m_spi == null) {
440      System.out.println("Setting up a new SPI port.");
441      m_spi = new SPI(m_spi_port);
442      m_spi.setClockRate(2000000);
443      m_spi.setMSBFirst();
444      m_spi.setSampleDataOnTrailingEdge();
445      m_spi.setClockActiveLow();
446      m_spi.setChipSelectActiveLow();
447      readRegister(PROD_ID); // Dummy read
448
449      // Validate the product ID
450      if (readRegister(PROD_ID) != 16982) {
451        DriverStation.reportError("Could not find ADIS16470", false);
452        close();
453        return false;
454      }
455      return true;
456    } else {
457      // Maybe the SPI port is active, but not in auto SPI mode? Try to read the
458      // product ID.
459      readRegister(PROD_ID); // dummy read
460      if (readRegister(PROD_ID) != 16982) {
461        DriverStation.reportError("Could not find an ADIS16470", false);
462        close();
463        return false;
464      } else {
465        return true;
466      }
467    }
468  }
469
470  /** @return */
471  boolean switchToAutoSPI() {
472    // No SPI port has been set up. Go set one up first.
473    if (m_spi == null) {
474      if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
475        DriverStation.reportError("Failed to start/restart auto SPI", false);
476        return false;
477      }
478    }
479    // Only set up the interrupt if needed.
480    if (m_auto_interrupt == null) {
481      // Configure interrupt on SPI CS1
482      m_auto_interrupt = new DigitalInput(26);
483    }
484    // The auto SPI controller gets angry if you try to set up two instances on one
485    // bus.
486    if (!m_auto_configured) {
487      m_spi.initAuto(8200);
488      m_auto_configured = true;
489    }
490    // Do we need to change auto SPI settings?
491    switch (m_yaw_axis) {
492      case kX:
493        m_spi.setAutoTransmitData(m_autospi_x_packet, 2);
494        break;
495      case kY:
496        m_spi.setAutoTransmitData(m_autospi_y_packet, 2);
497        break;
498      default:
499        m_spi.setAutoTransmitData(m_autospi_z_packet, 2);
500        break;
501    }
502    // Configure auto stall time
503    m_spi.configureAutoStall(5, 1000, 1);
504    // Kick off auto SPI (Note: Device configration impossible after auto SPI is
505    // activated)
506    // DR High = Data good (data capture should be triggered on the rising edge)
507    m_spi.startAutoTrigger(m_auto_interrupt, true, false);
508
509    // Check to see if the acquire thread is running. If not, kick one off.
510    if (!m_acquire_task.isAlive()) {
511      m_first_run = true;
512      m_thread_active = true;
513      m_acquire_task.start();
514      System.out.println("Processing thread activated!");
515    } else {
516      // The thread was running, re-init run variables and start it up again.
517      m_first_run = true;
518      m_thread_active = true;
519      System.out.println("Processing thread activated!");
520    }
521    // Looks like the thread didn't start for some reason. Abort.
522    if (!m_acquire_task.isAlive()) {
523      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to start/restart the acquire() thread.", false);
524      close();
525      return false;
526    }
527    return true;
528  }
529
530  /**
531   * Configures calibration time
532   *
533   * @param new_cal_time New calibration time
534   * @return 1 if the new calibration time is the same as the current one else 0
535   */
536  public int configCalTime(ADIS16470CalibrationTime new_cal_time) {
537    if (m_calibration_time == new_cal_time.value) {
538      return 1;
539    }
540    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
541      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
542      return 2;
543    }
544    m_calibration_time = new_cal_time.value;
545    writeRegister(NULL_CNFG, (m_calibration_time | 0x700));
546    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
547      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
548      return 2;
549    }
550    return 0;
551  }
552
553  public int configDecRate(int reg) {
554    int m_reg = reg;
555    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
556      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
557      return 2;
558    }
559    if (m_reg > 1999) {
560      DriverStation.reportError("Attemted to write an invalid deimation value.", false);
561      m_reg = 1999;
562    }
563    m_scaled_sample_rate = (((m_reg + 1.0) / 2000.0) * 1000000.0);
564    writeRegister(DEC_RATE, m_reg);
565    System.out.println("Decimation register: " + readRegister(DEC_RATE));
566    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
567      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
568      return 2;
569    }
570    return 0;
571  }
572
573  /** {@inheritDoc} */
574  @Override
575  public void calibrate() {
576    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
577      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
578    }
579    writeRegister(GLOB_CMD, 0x0001);
580    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
581      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
582    }
583    ;
584  }
585
586  /**
587   * Sets the yaw axis
588   *
589   * @param yaw_axis The new yaw axis to use
590   * @return 1 if the new yaw axis is the same as the current one, 2 if the switch to Standard SPI
591   *     failed, else 0.
592   */
593  public int setYawAxis(IMUAxis yaw_axis) {
594    if (m_yaw_axis == yaw_axis) {
595      return 1;
596    }
597    if (!switchToStandardSPI()) {
598      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure standard SPI.", false);
599      return 2;
600    }
601    m_yaw_axis = yaw_axis;
602    if (!switchToAutoSPI()) {
603      DriverStation.reportError("Failed to configure/reconfigure auto SPI.", false);
604    }
605    return 0;
606  }
607
608  /**
609   * @param reg
610   * @return
611   */
612  private int readRegister(int reg) {
613    ByteBuffer buf = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(2);
614    buf.order(ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN);
615    buf.put(0, (byte) (reg & 0x7f));
616    buf.put(1, (byte) 0);
617
618    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
619    m_spi.read(false, buf, 2);
620
621    return toUShort(buf);
622  }
623
624  /**
625   * @param reg
626   * @param val
627   */
628  private void writeRegister(int reg, int val) {
629    ByteBuffer buf = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(2);
630    // low byte
631    buf.put(0, (byte) ((0x80 | reg)));
632    buf.put(1, (byte) (val & 0xff));
633    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
634    // high byte
635    buf.put(0, (byte) (0x81 | reg));
636    buf.put(1, (byte) (val >> 8));
637    m_spi.write(buf, 2);
638  }
639
640  /** {@inheritDoc} */
641  public void reset() {
642    synchronized (this) {
643      m_integ_angle = 0.0;
644    }
645  }
646
647  /** Delete (free) the spi port used for the IMU. */
648  @Override
649  public void close() {
650    if (m_thread_active) {
651      m_thread_active = false;
652      try {
653        if (m_acquire_task != null) {
654          m_acquire_task.join();
655          m_acquire_task = null;
656        }
657      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
658      }
659      if (m_spi != null) {
660        if (m_auto_configured) {
661          m_spi.stopAuto();
662        }
663        m_spi.close();
664        m_auto_configured = false;
665        if (m_auto_interrupt != null) {
666          m_auto_interrupt.close();
667          m_auto_interrupt = null;
668        }
669        m_spi = null;
670      }
671    }
672    System.out.println("Finished cleaning up after the IMU driver.");
673  }
674
675  /** */
676  private void acquire() {
677    // Set data packet length
678    final int dataset_len = 19; // 18 data points + timestamp
679    final int BUFFER_SIZE = 4000;
680
681    // Set up buffers and variables
682    int[] buffer = new int[BUFFER_SIZE];
683    int data_count = 0;
684    int data_remainder = 0;
685    int data_to_read = 0;
686    double previous_timestamp = 0.0;
687    double delta_angle = 0.0;
688    double gyro_x = 0.0;
689    double gyro_y = 0.0;
690    double gyro_z = 0.0;
691    double accel_x = 0.0;
692    double accel_y = 0.0;
693    double accel_z = 0.0;
694    double gyro_x_si = 0.0;
695    double gyro_y_si = 0.0;
696    double gyro_z_si = 0.0;
697    double accel_x_si = 0.0;
698    double accel_y_si = 0.0;
699    double accel_z_si = 0.0;
700    double compAngleX = 0.0;
701    double compAngleY = 0.0;
702    double accelAngleX = 0.0;
703    double accelAngleY = 0.0;
704
705    while (true) {
706      // Sleep loop for 10ms
707      try {
708        Thread.sleep(10);
709      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
710      }
711
712      if (m_thread_active) {
713        m_thread_idle = false;
714
715        data_count =
716            m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(
717                buffer, 0, 0); // Read number of bytes currently stored in the
718        // buffer
719        data_remainder =
720            data_count % dataset_len; // Check if frame is incomplete. Add 1 because of timestamp
721        data_to_read = data_count - data_remainder; // Remove incomplete data from read count
722        /* Want to cap the data to read in a single read at the buffer size */
723        if (data_to_read > BUFFER_SIZE) {
724          DriverStation.reportWarning(
725              "ADIS16470 data processing thread overrun has occurred!", false);
726          data_to_read = BUFFER_SIZE - (BUFFER_SIZE % dataset_len);
727        }
728        m_spi.readAutoReceivedData(
729            buffer, data_to_read, 0); // Read data from DMA buffer (only complete sets)
730
731        // Could be multiple data sets in the buffer. Handle each one.
732        for (int i = 0; i < data_to_read; i += dataset_len) {
733          // Timestamp is at buffer[i]
734          m_dt = ((double) buffer[i] - previous_timestamp) / 1000000.0;
735
736          /*
737           * System.out.println(((toInt(buffer[i + 3], buffer[i + 4], buffer[i + 5],
738           * buffer[i + 6]))*delta_angle_sf) / ((10000.0 / (buffer[i] -
739           * previous_timestamp)) / 100.0));
740           * // DEBUG: Plot Sub-Array Data in Terminal
741           * for (int j = 0; j < data_to_read; j++) {
742           * System.out.print(buffer[j]);
743           * System.out.print(" ,");
744           * }
745           * System.out.println(" ");
746           * //System.out.println(((toInt(buffer[i + 3], buffer[i + 4], buffer[i + 5],
747           * buffer[i + 6]))*delta_angle_sf) / ((10000.0 / (buffer[i] -
748           * previous_timestamp)) / 100.0) + "," + buffer[3] + "," + buffer[4] + "," +
749           * buffer[5] + "," + buffer[6]
750           * /*toShort(buffer[7], buffer[8]) + "," +
751           * toShort(buffer[9], buffer[10]) + "," +
752           * toShort(buffer[11], buffer[12]) + "," +
753           * toShort(buffer[13], buffer[14]) + "," +
754           * toShort(buffer[15], buffer[16]) + ","
755           * + toShort(buffer[17], buffer[18]));
756           */
757
758          /*
759           * Get delta angle value for selected yaw axis and scale by the elapsed time
760           * (based on timestamp)
761           */
762          delta_angle =
763              (toInt(buffer[i + 3], buffer[i + 4], buffer[i + 5], buffer[i + 6]) * delta_angle_sf)
764                  / (m_scaled_sample_rate / (buffer[i] - previous_timestamp));
765          gyro_x = (toShort(buffer[i + 7], buffer[i + 8]) / 10.0);
766          gyro_y = (toShort(buffer[i + 9], buffer[i + 10]) / 10.0);
767          gyro_z = (toShort(buffer[i + 11], buffer[i + 12]) / 10.0);
768          accel_x = (toShort(buffer[i + 13], buffer[i + 14]) / 800.0);
769          accel_y = (toShort(buffer[i + 15], buffer[i + 16]) / 800.0);
770          accel_z = (toShort(buffer[i + 17], buffer[i + 18]) / 800.0);
771
772          // Convert scaled sensor data to SI units (for tilt calculations)
773          // TODO: Should the unit outputs be selectable?
774          gyro_x_si = gyro_x * deg_to_rad;
775          gyro_y_si = gyro_y * deg_to_rad;
776          gyro_z_si = gyro_z * deg_to_rad;
777          accel_x_si = accel_x * grav;
778          accel_y_si = accel_y * grav;
779          accel_z_si = accel_z * grav;
780
781          // Store timestamp for next iteration
782          previous_timestamp = buffer[i];
783
784          m_alpha = m_tau / (m_tau + m_dt);
785
786          if (m_first_run) {
787            // Set up inclinometer calculations for first run
788            accelAngleX =
789                Math.atan2(
790                    accel_x_si, Math.sqrt((accel_y_si * accel_y_si) + (accel_z_si * accel_z_si)));
791            accelAngleY =
792                Math.atan2(
793                    accel_y_si, Math.sqrt((accel_x_si * accel_x_si) + (accel_z_si * accel_z_si)));
794            compAngleX = accelAngleX;
795            compAngleY = accelAngleY;
796          } else {
797            // Run inclinometer calculations
798            accelAngleX =
799                Math.atan2(
800                    accel_x_si, Math.sqrt((accel_y_si * accel_y_si) + (accel_z_si * accel_z_si)));
801            accelAngleY =
802                Math.atan2(
803                    accel_y_si, Math.sqrt((accel_x_si * accel_x_si) + (accel_z_si * accel_z_si)));
804            accelAngleX = formatAccelRange(accelAngleX, accel_z_si);
805            accelAngleY = formatAccelRange(accelAngleY, accel_z_si);
806            compAngleX = compFilterProcess(compAngleX, accelAngleX, -gyro_y_si);
807            compAngleY = compFilterProcess(compAngleY, accelAngleY, gyro_x_si);
808          }
809
810          synchronized (this) {
811            /* Push data to global variables */
812            if (m_first_run) {
813              /*
814               * Don't accumulate first run. previous_timestamp will be "very" old and the
815               * integration will end up way off
816               */
817              m_integ_angle = 0.0;
818            } else {
819              m_integ_angle += delta_angle;
820            }
821            m_gyro_x = gyro_x;
822            m_gyro_y = gyro_y;
823            m_gyro_z = gyro_z;
824            m_accel_x = accel_x;
825            m_accel_y = accel_y;
826            m_accel_z = accel_z;
827            m_compAngleX = compAngleX * rad_to_deg;
828            m_compAngleY = compAngleY * rad_to_deg;
829            m_accelAngleX = accelAngleX * rad_to_deg;
830            m_accelAngleY = accelAngleY * rad_to_deg;
831          }
832          m_first_run = false;
833        }
834      } else {
835        m_thread_idle = true;
836        data_count = 0;
837        data_remainder = 0;
838        data_to_read = 0;
839        previous_timestamp = 0.0;
840        delta_angle = 0.0;
841        gyro_x = 0.0;
842        gyro_y = 0.0;
843        gyro_z = 0.0;
844        accel_x = 0.0;
845        accel_y = 0.0;
846        accel_z = 0.0;
847        gyro_x_si = 0.0;
848        gyro_y_si = 0.0;
849        gyro_z_si = 0.0;
850        accel_x_si = 0.0;
851        accel_y_si = 0.0;
852        accel_z_si = 0.0;
853        compAngleX = 0.0;
854        compAngleY = 0.0;
855        accelAngleX = 0.0;
856        accelAngleY = 0.0;
857      }
858    }
859  }
860
861  /**
862   * @param compAngle
863   * @param accAngle
864   * @return
865   */
866  private double formatFastConverge(double compAngle, double accAngle) {
867    if (compAngle > accAngle + Math.PI) {
868      compAngle = compAngle - 2.0 * Math.PI;
869    } else if (accAngle > compAngle + Math.PI) {
870      compAngle = compAngle + 2.0 * Math.PI;
871    }
872    return compAngle;
873  }
874
875  /**
876   * @param compAngle
877   * @return
878   */
879  private double formatRange0to2PI(double compAngle) {
880    while (compAngle >= 2 * Math.PI) {
881      compAngle = compAngle - 2.0 * Math.PI;
882    }
883    while (compAngle < 0.0) {
884      compAngle = compAngle + 2.0 * Math.PI;
885    }
886    return compAngle;
887  }
888
889  /**
890   * @param accelAngle
891   * @param accelZ
892   * @return
893   */
894  private double formatAccelRange(double accelAngle, double accelZ) {
895    if (accelZ < 0.0) {
896      accelAngle = Math.PI - accelAngle;
897    } else if (accelZ > 0.0 && accelAngle < 0.0) {
898      accelAngle = 2.0 * Math.PI + accelAngle;
899    }
900    return accelAngle;
901  }
902
903  /**
904   * @param compAngle
905   * @param accelAngle
906   * @param omega
907   * @return
908   */
909  private double compFilterProcess(double compAngle, double accelAngle, double omega) {
910    compAngle = formatFastConverge(compAngle, accelAngle);
911    compAngle = m_alpha * (compAngle + omega * m_dt) + (1.0 - m_alpha) * accelAngle;
912    compAngle = formatRange0to2PI(compAngle);
913    if (compAngle > Math.PI) {
914      compAngle = compAngle - 2.0 * Math.PI;
915    }
916    return compAngle;
917  }
918
919  /** {@inheritDoc} */
920  public synchronized double getAngle() {
921    switch (m_yaw_axis) {
922      case kX:
923        if (m_simGyroAngleX != null) {
924          return m_simGyroAngleX.get();
925        }
926        break;
927      case kY:
928        if (m_simGyroAngleY != null) {
929          return m_simGyroAngleY.get();
930        }
931        break;
932      case kZ:
933        if (m_simGyroAngleZ != null) {
934          return m_simGyroAngleZ.get();
935        }
936        break;
937    }
938    return m_integ_angle;
939  }
940
941  /** {@inheritDoc} */
942  public synchronized double getRate() {
943    switch (m_yaw_axis) {
944      case kX:
945        return getGyroRateX();
946      case kY:
947        return getGyroRateY();
948      case kZ:
949        return getGyroRateZ();
950    }
951    return 0.0;
952  }
953
954  /** @return Yaw Axis */
955  public IMUAxis getYawAxis() {
956    return m_yaw_axis;
957  }
958
959  /** @return current gyro angle in the X direction */
960  public synchronized double getGyroRateX() {
961    if (m_simGyroRateX != null) {
962      return m_simGyroRateX.get();
963    }
964    return m_gyro_x;
965  }
966
967  /** @return current gyro angle in the Y axis */
968  public synchronized double getGyroRateY() {
969    if (m_simGyroRateY != null) {
970      return m_simGyroRateY.get();
971    }
972    return m_gyro_y;
973  }
974
975  /** @return current gyro angle in the Z axis */
976  public synchronized double getGyroRateZ() {
977    if (m_simGyroRateZ != null) {
978      return m_simGyroRateZ.get();
979    }
980    return m_gyro_z;
981  }
982
983  /** @return current acceleration in the X axis */
984  public synchronized double getAccelInstantX() {
985    return m_accel_x;
986  }
987
988  /** @return current acceleration in the Y axis */
989  public synchronized double getAccelInstantY() {
990    return m_accel_y;
991  }
992
993  /** @return current acceleration in the Z axis */
994  public synchronized double getAccelInstantZ() {
995    return m_accel_z;
996  }
997
998  /** @return X axis complementary angle */
999  public synchronized double getXComplementaryAngle() {
1000    return m_compAngleX;
1001  }
1002
1003  /** @return Y axis complementary angle */
1004  public synchronized double getYComplementaryAngle() {
1005    return m_compAngleY;
1006  }
1007
1008  /** @return X axis filtered acceleration angle */
1009  public synchronized double getXFilteredAccelAngle() {
1010    return m_accelAngleX;
1011  }
1012
1013  /** @return Y axis filtered acceleration angle */
1014  public synchronized double getYFilteredAccelAngle() {
1015    return m_accelAngleY;
1016  }
1017
1018  /**
1019   * Get the SPI port number.
1020   *
1021   * @return The SPI port number.
1022   */
1023  public int getPort() {
1024    return m_spi_port.value;
1025  }
1026
1027  @Override
1028  public void initSendable(NTSendableBuilder builder) {
1029    builder.setSmartDashboardType("Gyro");
1030    builder.addDoubleProperty("Value", this::getAngle, null);
1031  }
1032}
